reviews.text: Well, what can I tell you about the Seamill Hydro. My friend and I stayed here for a couple of days this month. We were allocated to Room 46 on the top floor - probably the most characterful room in the hotel (although they are all quite non-standard). It has a tiny little window in the middle of the apex of the room and the beds were fitted into the Apex so a wee bit unusual. I am surpirsed, given that the hotel is over 100 years old, no-one seems to have mentioned the little "Caspers" (friendly ghosts!) at the hotel. There were definately things going bump in the night!! (and no you lot, the spirits we are talking about were not in our drinking glasses!!)
reviews.title: very characterful hotel

reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.text: Having said all this, I loved the hotel. All the staff (apart from one sniffy receptionist) were fantastic, the food was fabulous, the views and beach walks amazing and makes for a very relaxing break. Make sure you get a gate key to allow you onto the private beach.
reviews.title: unwelcoming staff and noisey

reviews.text: One word of advice - the Hydro have a strange system of coming into your room during breakfast on your last day to change the beds and remove all the towels bar one hand towel. This means you cannot really use the full facilities of the room (i.e. lounge on your bed and read the papers after breakfast. I did notice one other reviewer found dirty sheets and wondered if this was because they changed the bed and someone decided to get back into it again as they had not yet checked out. On your last day you must put the Do Not Disturb sign on the door or your room will be half cleaned before you leave - "here's your coat, what's your hurry".
reviews.title: excellant graduation ball function

reviews.text: The Seamill Hydro is a popular and well known hotel on the Ayrshire coast, often used by the Scottish football squad (they have good sports facilities, including a five-a-side pitch, tennis court, small gym and pool). The hotel is surprisingly big and, if you can, try and book a room with a view out over the Firth of Clyde. Very tranquill! Rooms have fairly good facilities, not quite Hilton or Marriott standard but close enough. The bistro restaurant has a good menu, with a variety of dishes from curries to fish & chips, haggis to sea bass. At breakfast though, I couldn't get any porridge! The kippers looked good as an alternative, but a bit pungent for me in the mornings. All in all, this has to be one of the best hotels on the coast.
reviews.title: Get a Sea View!
Amazing Wedding location
reviews.text: I recently got married at Seamill Hydro and thoroughly enjoyed the day. The location was absolutely beautiful, staff were superb and the meal was excellent. We stayed in the Ardneig Suite which was extremely spacious and with 2 small children this is a must! The children were catered for, which does not happen very often in the standard of hotel. They had a kids club for the over 2's and had a babysitting service and baby listening service for younger children. There is nowhere in the hotel that the children are not allowed and the swimming pool is very child friendly. The hotel ofers a beauty salon but booking is advisable. Definately recommend for families and couples alike

reviews.title: waiting to go back
reviews.text: I have stayed here on various occasions over the years 1) weekend seminar with local college, facilites and service were great 2) saturday night dinner dance, breakfast deal, great night. a little reluctant at first as i thought it might be for the more mature age group (we were in our early 30's and had a great night 3) company christmas night out, again a great night and breakfast delivered to the room saved the hassle of rushing to get ready 4) looking to stay in may 04 as wedding guests and possibly later in year for family break

reviews.title: Seamill Heaven
reviews.text: Oh! visit the little shop it is a treasure trove of bags,jewellery,Scottish things and lots of toys for the kids. Very helpful lady who couldn't do enough for us.

My daughter and I and her daughter Holly spent a fab 3 days at Seamill - it was a fantastic special offer. A family room (roomy) dinner, bed and breakfast plus full use of the leisure facilities (free towels and swimming aids) all for £245. Holly visited the kids club (also included and loads to do) whilst my daughter and I went for dinner or walked round the grounds. The hotel is right on the beach and you'll have your own key to a gate onto the sands for a stroll. The menu was great, service well above average.
